thread.title: In The Flesh creator sends out tweet encouraging fans to back film idea - In The Flesh Cult
thread.title_full: In The Flesh creator sends out tweet encouraging fans to back film idea - In The Flesh News - Cult - Digital Spy

author: Sam Warner
title: In The Flesh creator sends out tweet encouraging fans to back film idea - In The Flesh Cult
text: Could In The Flesh be brought back in film form? It's not impossible, at least according to its creator.Dominic Mitchell sent out a tweet that has got the former BBC Three supernatural drama's fans excited.I calculate a stand alone film of #InTheFlesh would need a £1 million budget. Not beyond the realms of possibility...— Dominic Mitchell (@DomMitchell) October 14, 2015He wrote: "I calculate a stand alone film of #InTheFlesh would need a £1 million budget. Not beyond the realms of possibility..."Since sending that tweet, Mitchell suggested that if enough fans get behind the idea of a movie he would explore how to approach it, and encouraged them to "hashtag the hell out of #InTheFleshMovie".Not official. Enough people show they want #InTheFleshMovie who knows? Definitely exploring how to make it happen. https://t.co/n1hWuZ0T7F— Dominic Mitchell (@DomMitchell) October 15, 2015Hashtag the hell out of #InTheFleshMovie That's a start. Get the ball rolling on the old social media. https://t.co/IWiDw6oPeQ— Dominic Mitchell (@DomMitchell) October 15, 2015Yes a #InTheFleshMovie is doable. With a good script, investment, and fan passion. https://t.co/wQspJ5CqGT— Dominic Mitchell (@DomMitchell) October 15, 2015I'd need to write a screenplay first. #InTheFlesh fans what's the most pressing questions you'd like to see answered? #InTheFleshTheMovie— Dominic Mitchell (@DomMitchell) October 15, 2015Thanks for all the lovely messages #InTheFlesh fans. I guess if you want something done you've got to do it yourself...#InTheFleshMovie— Dominic Mitchell (@DomMitchell) October 15, 2015In The Flesh was axed after two series early this year due to drama budgets, though fans have since started a campaign to renew the series.Star Luke Newberry has previously said that he would "love to do it again". © BBCIn The Flesh In The Flesh: Inside the fan campaign to revive BBC Three's axed seriesThe drama follows a world where the undead are partly restored thanks to medical science, starring Newberry as Kieran Walker, a 'partially deceased' teenager.
